title: OSHA Asbestos Documentation Requirements Explained
summary: An operational breakdown of required asbestos records, survey documentation, monitoring records, and retention workflows.

sections.heading: Required Records
body: Outline required record categories used in asbestos compliance programs.
Describe operational controls for completeness and consistency.
Explain how missing records create regulatory and legal exposure.

sections.heading: Survey Documentation
body: Describe survey metadata, location fidelity, and chain-of-custody requirements.
Show what high-quality asbestos survey documentation should include.
Highlight common survey documentation gaps and how to prevent them.

sections.heading: Air Monitoring Records
body: Explain what must be retained from sampling and calibration workflows.
Connect monitoring records to defensible reporting outputs.
Describe practical QA checks before final report publication.

sections.heading: Retention Requirements
body: Summarize retention policy considerations for asbestos documentation.
Show how to implement governed retention in digital workflows.
Describe retrieval and audit response best practices.

faqs.question: Which asbestos records are most frequently missing?
faqs.answer: Organizations commonly miss complete sample metadata, custody references, and report-to-source traceability.

faqs.question: How should retention policies be handled?
faqs.answer: Retention should follow a consistent policy with governed storage and reliable retrieval workflows.
